title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 31 March 2015 - XWiki
content:
<lucaa> has quit  
00:16 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
00:16 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
01:31 <vrachieru> has quit  
03:17 <lucaa> has quit  
06:01 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:04 <Denis> has quit  
06:14 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
06:53 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
07:58 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:59 <cjd> has quit  
08:04 <martin-h> has quit  
08:15 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:20 <DarkKnightCZ> mflorea: hi, just fyi, this is the final working code - http://pastebin.com/T8NadUWJ , i just couldn't find any other way how to test if the element is img (elem instanceof ImageElement worked for every element)  
08:20 <mflorea> let me see  
08:24 <mflorea> elem.getTagName().equalsIgnoreCase("IMG") <--- that's exactly what you had to do (check the tag name), although, as a best practice, when checking if some expression equals a constant string, I usually put the constant string first to avoid any NPE:  
08:24 <mflorea> "img".equalsIgnoreCase(elem.getTagName())  
08:24 <mflorea> looks good  
08:25 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:33 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:49 <vmassol> has quit  
08:52 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <DarkKnightCZ> mflorea: yup, thanks  
09:42 <mflorea> has quit  
09:59 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <lucaa> has quit  
10:56 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <Trefex> hey  
12:23 <Trefex> so, when the LDAP server is not responding, it seems local logins also don't work anymore  
12:23 <Trefex> my guess is some wrong timeout or something  
12:23 <Trefex> the wiki just doesn't respond  
12:24 <Trefex> doesn't respnd = takes forever  
12:28 <tmortagne> sounds like timeout indeed but the default is 1000 ms AFAIK  
12:29 <tmortagne> see xwiki.authentication.ldap.timeout in xwiki.cfg  
12:29 <tmortagne> you could enable LDAP debug log to see where it's stuck exactly  
12:30 <tmortagne> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication#HEnableLDAPdebuglog  
12:31 <Trefex> it does take longer than 1 secon  
12:32 <Trefex> 2015-03-31 12:25:05,956 [https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/bin/loginsubmit/XWiki/XWikiLogin] DEBUG u.i.L.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl - Trying authentication against XWiki DB  
12:32 <Trefex> 2015-03-31 12:25:05,956 [https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/bin/loginsubmit/XWiki/XWikiLogin] DEBUG u.i.L.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl - LDAP authentication succeed with principal [XWiki.Admin]  
12:32 <Trefex> this is where it stuck more or less  
12:33 <Trefex> tmortagne: is it possible to regenerate the icons and so on on the Main wiki?  
12:34 <tmortagne> what you printed is after LDAP when LDAP already failed  
12:35 <tmortagne> that's the fallback on XWiki standard users  
12:35 <tmortagne> not sure what you mean exactly about icons  
12:35 <tmortagne> icons of what ?  
12:36 <Trefex> in the admin panel, all my icons are gone tmortagne  
12:36 <Trefex> yeah the fallback is where it hangs  
12:37 <Trefex> https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/bin/download/XWiki/AdminSheet/configuration.png 404  
12:37 <Trefex> and all other icons as well  
12:38 <tmortagne> most standard icons are in file system not in attachments  
12:38 <tmortagne> what version of XWiki is that ?  
12:39 <Trefex> latest stable  
12:39 <Trefex> 6.4.3  
12:40 <tmortagne> so most standard icons are actually fonts now  
12:41 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau might understand better your issue  
12:41 <Trefex> 7 is out ?  
12:41 <tmortagne> just yesterday  
12:41 <Trefex> ok i'll upgrade  
12:41 <tmortagne> I'm far from a skin expert  
12:41 <tmortagne> there is no much difference between 6.4.3 and 7.0 visually  
12:41 <gdelhumeau> the default icon set is stored in IconThemes.FontAwesome  
12:42 <gdelhumeau> as an attachment  
12:42 <Trefex> well that's all well, but what can I do with all those 404? gdelhumeau :)  
12:42 <Trefex> i'll upgrade to 7, and we can start from there if you're willing to help of course  
12:50 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: perhaps we need a better way for waiting in this test? http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-7.0.x/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-wiki-test-tests/testReport/org.xwiki.wiki.test.ui/WikiTemplateTest/createWikiFromTemplateTest/  
12:51 <Enygma`> probably the default timeout does not work very well  
12:51 <gdelhumeau> how much time is it?  
12:51 <gdelhumeau> 30seconds ?  
12:51 <gdelhumeau> normally it installs a very little XAR, but sometime the agent is very slow  
12:52 <Trefex> why was lucene plugin remove in xwiki.cfg for v7?  
12:53 <gdelhumeau> because it was replaced bby solr  
12:53 <Trefex> kk thanks  
12:53 <Trefex> was merging my changes from xwiki.cfg into new version  
12:55 <Trefex> upgrade failed, haha  
12:55 <Trefex> http://pastebin.com/5fDxrEhk  
12:56 <Trefex> upgrading from 6.4.3 to latest 7 stable  
12:57 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: I think it`s 10  
12:57 <Enygma`> since we override selenium`s default AFAIK  
12:59 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: yes see XWikiWebDriver  
12:59 <vmassol> if something is taking longer than 10 seconds we need to fix it (or fix the test)  
12:59 <vmassol> btw for very special use cases  
13:00 <vmassol> we allow the test to set a longer timeout  
13:00 <martin-h> has joined #xwiki  
13:00 <vmassol> (very special use cases = when there's no other choice and we lack imagination to make it fast)  
13:00 <vmassol> in your case here maybe you could test with a smaller template  
13:01 <vmassol> ?  
13:01 <lucaa> has quit  
13:03 <Trefex> is file mode not supported anymore for attachments?  
13:03 <vmassol> it is supported  
13:04 <Trefex> vmassol: ok, any clue about my error ?  
13:04 <vmassol> yes  
13:04 <vmassol> 1. Caused by: class java.lang.AbstractMethodError: org.postgresql.jdbc3.Jdbc3Connection.isValid(I)Z  
13:04 <Trefex> oh it seems i should upgrade my jdbc driver?  
13:04 <vmassol> your JDBC driver is not correct  
13:05 <Trefex> shouldn't this be a dependancy in the upgrade packages ?  
13:05 <vmassol> the version is not correct  
13:05 <vmassol> wdym?  
13:05 <vmassol> what upgrade package?  
13:05 <Trefex> the debian packages of xwiki  
13:05 <vmassol> we provide debian package for postgresql?  
13:05 <Trefex> yes?  
13:06 <vmassol> ok, never used debian  
13:06 <Trefex> xwiki-enterprise-tomcat7-pgsql - XWiki enterprise Tomcat7/PostgreSQL  
13:06 <vmassol> however I fail to see why the driver would need to be changed  
13:06 <vmassol> unless we changed the version of pgsql  
13:06 <vmassol> the version required  
13:07 <vmassol> anyway I don't know anything about the debian packaging, would be nice if you could raise a jira issue :)  
13:07 <Trefex> now i'm running 9.3.6 it seems  
13:07 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org  
13:11 <Trefex> vmassol: under commons or where?  
13:11 <vmassol> enterprise  
13:11 <vmassol> xwiki-enterprise  
13:11 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE  
13:13 <Trefex> crap  
13:14 <Trefex> already hit submit :D  
13:14 <vmassol> :)  
13:14 <Trefex> ok, moved  
13:19 <Trefex> well then, not sure how to update JDBC driver, so my wiki is broken :D  
13:22 <vmassol> Trefex: the jdbc driver should be in WEB-INF/lib I guess  
13:24 <Trefex> nope  
13:24 <Trefex> guess it's using a global one  
13:36 <Trefex> i think i fixed it: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1478  
13:45 <tmortagne> Trefex: about postgres package XWiki don't include it but use whatever is the one supported by the system, it's just declared as dependency  
13:46 <Trefex> well...  
13:46 <tmortagne> I find weird that the driver is so old that it does not work  
13:46 <tmortagne> what system is it ?  
13:46 <Trefex> Debian 7  
13:46 <Trefex> oups  
13:46 <Trefex> strike that  
13:46 <Trefex> Ubuntu 12.04 upgraded to 14.  
13:47 <tmortagne> I also don't see why something that work with 6.4 would not for 7.0, we id not upgraded hibernate or anything  
13:47 <tmortagne> s/id/did/  
13:49 <Trefex> well all i did was apt-get upgrade tmortagne  
13:49 <Trefex> so i'm not sure what broke it on the way  
13:50 <tmortagne> could you paste the full error somewhere  
13:50 <tmortagne> I would like to see what is calling the method generating the error you pasted  
13:50 <tmortagne> on XWiki side all we do is a link to the system postgresql java connector  
13:51 <tmortagne> so we don't really have much control on the version of the connector  
13:52 <Trefex> the missing icon issue was because i switch from hibernate to file, and had to migrate attachments from DB to disk  
13:53 <Trefex> tmortagne: didn't have more output than http://pastebin.com/5fDxrEhk  
13:56 <Trefex> tmortagne: vmassol do you guys know if it's possible to push to a wiki using a git repo?  
13:57 <Trefex> i mean, wouldn't it be cool to change your .md files locally, then commit, push and it would get updated on the wiki ?  
14:00 <DarkKnightCZ> Trefex: there is REST api, which accepts markdown syntax... you can create simple script that will push it via curl and add it as a hook (if you're using something like github)  
14:00 <Trefex> DarkKnightCZ: do you have link to doc?  
14:00 <Trefex> which describe something like that?  
14:00 <tmortagne> there is idea about using git as storage but that's just an idea right now, I don't know any automated sync between git and XWiki but I guess there is some tools in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Application+-+GitHub+App  
14:00 <DarkKnightCZ> Trefex: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/XWikiRESTfulAPI  
14:01 <tmortagne> and yes the other possibility is doing the sync on your side using th REST API  
14:01 <Trefex> tmortagne: well or i should rephrase my question, how about i want to edit my .md files in Atom  
14:01 <Trefex> locally  
14:01 <Trefex> but want to use the power of xwiki, then i'm more or less stuck correect?  
14:02 <tmortagne> without pushing ?  
14:02 <Trefex> well however  
14:02 <vmassol> Trefex: yes it would be nice to do that. Note that we have something similar already with the Git Extension  
14:02 <tmortagne> what DarkKnightCZ suggested sounds like something you could do  
14:02 <vmassol> (it's not a push but it's a pull though)  
14:03 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Application+-+GitHub+App  
14:03 <Trefex> vmassol: would that be automatic though?  
14:03 <vmassol> s/git/github  
14:03 <vmassol> it's a bidirectional bridge  
14:04 <tmortagne> I doubt it's automatic in the github app  
14:04 <tmortagne> probably something you ask  
14:04 <tmortagne> but you could put that in a scheduler  
14:05 <DarkKnightCZ> or create scripted document and add it as a hook (it will be automatically loaded when you push something)  
14:05 <tmortagne> or that yes, some document to execute when a push is done  
14:16 <John> has joined #xwiki  
14:16 <John> is now known as <Guest52113>  
14:26 <Trefex> DarkKnightCZ: ok, so you would "pull" the github changes within the script (document) triggered by a push?  
14:26 <vmassol> Trefex: my goal of some time back was to implement an XWiki store using Git  
14:26 <vmassol> (i.e. no sync)  
14:27 <Trefex> so xwiki would directly sit on git, similar to gollum? vmassol  
14:27 <vmassol> but I haven't done it yet and one preliminary need  is to refactor our store API to extract the search\*() methods out and have some other code handle that (like SOLR)  
14:27 <vmassol> yes  
14:28 <vmassol> in any case it's a lot of work  
14:28 <vmassol> but if we wish to support various backends we would need to do that  
14:28 <vmassol> (various = nosql backends for example, git, etc)  
14:28 <vmassol> or keep the search\*() methods but implement them using SOLR for git  
14:28 <Guest52113> has quit  
14:29 <vmassol> (probably more realistic)  
14:29 <cjd> Trefex: I wrote a tool for building and importing/exporting xwiki documents but it's undocumented at the moment  
14:29 <Trefex> two more qurstions. 1. Does the WYSIWYG editor support Google Open fonts? and 2. Is there support for drag&drop of images?  
14:30 <Trefex> vmassol: i see, well a sync is not so much an issue, if it could be done automatically, but then pushing changes back to git could be an issue, i see....  
14:30 <cjd> my tool is something like...     dumpdocument http://yourwiki/xwiki/Whatever/Document  
14:30 <vmassol> well both use cases are useful  
14:30 <vmassol> they're different  
14:31 <Trefex> cjd: i see, what does it do?  
14:31 <cjd> then edit the file which is created:  xwiki/Whatever/Document/content.xwiki20  
14:31 <cjd> then with a little script you can either gen a .xar file or auto-import it back into the wiki  
14:31 <vmassol> yet another solution is to use webdav and put the content into git :)  
14:31 <vmassol> (since we support webdav)  
14:32 <vmassol> (although webdav has shown to be pretty flaky depending on the OS)  
14:32 <vmassol> Trefex: yes  
14:32 <Trefex> in fact, vmassol i couldn't find much informative doc on the point of webdav in the xwiki context  
14:32 <Trefex> xwikibot: shut up :D  
14:32 <vmassol> well there are limitations but the content is in plain text in a text file  
14:32 <vmassol> :)  
14:32 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <Trefex> for some cases this could be nice  
14:33 <vmassol> the xobjects are not exposed as separate files though  
14:33 <cjd> <ad> my tool's justification is that it will retain \*all\* wiki information from the documents which it dumps, content/xobjects/xclasses/attachments </ad>  
14:33 <vmassol> yes I'd like that we implement an export/import of wiki pages as a flat structure of plain text files  
14:34 <vmassol> we started defining some structure on design.xwiki.org I think  
14:34 <vmassol> cjd has done his tool externally but I'd love to see a real xwiki extensions  
14:34 <vmassol> (using the Filter module for example)  
14:35 <cjd> yeah, it's not meant to be invoked from inside of the wiki  
14:35 <DarkKnightCZ> Trefex: yes, exactly (the pull)  
14:35 <vmassol> some ideas here: http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/DirectoryStructureforXWikiApplications  
14:35 <vmassol> (points to https://github.com/fmancinelli/xwikifs too btw)  
14:35 <Trefex> amagawd, so many thngs :D  
14:35 <vmassol> hehe  
14:36 <vmassol> lots of ideas on this topic  
14:36 <vmassol> but no implementation that rules them all ATM :)  
14:36 <vmassol> ie nothing really perfect yet  
14:46 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:48 <lucaa> has quit  
15:09 <gsmeria> has quit  
15:11 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
15:18 <tmortagne> vmassol: looks like what makes use now depends on jdbc 4 in 7.0 is XCOMMONS-756  
15:19 <tmortagne> (the issue Trefex had after upgrading from 6.4 to 7.0)  
15:19 <vmassol> interesting...  
15:20 <vmassol> reading http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-dbcp/changes-report.html  
15:20 <vmassol> it says " Version 2.0.x supports JDBC 4.1, so requires Java 7."  
15:20 <vmassol> but it doesn't say it doesn't support older jdbc versions  
15:21 <vmassol> it does say "Java 1.4 and Java 5 users should use DBCP 1.3.x which supports JDBC 3."  
15:21 <vmassol> "Version 1.4 supports JDBC 4, so requires JDK 1.6"  
15:22 <vmassol> so it seems DBCP 1.3 was the latest one supporting JDBC3 I think  
15:23 <tmortagne> yep dbcp release note is not rally clear about that but it's designed for jsbc 4  
15:23 <tmortagne> \*jdbc  
15:23 <vmassol> it's possible that they dropped support for jdbc3 in 2.0  
15:23 <tmortagne> now 7.0 is not a bad occasion to do this kind of upgrade but it was unexpected and we need to be sure we want that  
15:23 <vmassol> yep  
15:24 <vmassol> at least I wasn't aware of this when I upgraded so it wasn't "planned"  
15:24 <vmassol> so, the question is: do we wish to keep using DBCP 2.1  
15:24 <vmassol> AFAIK it shouldn't be a problem except that jdbc drivers might need to be updated  
15:24 <tmortagne> or is it ok to require jdbc 4  
15:25 <vmassol> but it's not a bad thing to uprgade the jdbc drivers too  
15:25 <tmortagne> yes it's ok to keep drivers up to date, but we need to make sure what it means for each database we support  
15:25 <vmassol> for hsqldb apparently it's not an issue  
15:26 <vmassol> (at least for the driver we use)  
15:26 <tmortagne> on postgre side looks like they publish difference driver for jdbc 3 et 4, mysql seems to have only one  
15:26 <vmassol> we haven't updated in a while btw, checking  
15:26 <tmortagne> no idea for Oracle  
15:26 <vmassol> latest hsqldb is 2.3.2  
15:26 <tmortagne> we update hsqldb often AFAIK  
15:26 <vmassol> we use 2.3.1  
15:26 <vmassol> "The latest version 2.3.2 improves on access and management of very large data sets. It supports up to 270 billion rows of data in a single database and a hot backup capability."  
15:27 <tmortagne> I see 2.3.2 in the pom.xml  
15:27 <vmassol> hot backup is cool actually  
15:27 <tmortagne> where are you looking at ?  
15:27 <vmassol> <!-- Version of HSQLDB that we use in Platform when import XARs for creating functional test environments -->  
15:27 <vmassol> <hsqldb.version>2.3.1</hsqldb.version>  
15:27 <vmassol> in platform  
15:27 <tmortagne> I'm looking at XE  
15:27 <vmassol> :)  
15:27 <tmortagne> so we are using 2.3.2 but I guess we use 2.3.1 in the I tests  
15:27 <tmortagne> we should move this property in a common place  
15:28 <vmassol> someone forgot to update  
15:28 <cjd> I think hot backup is the #1 reason for replication setups, just supporting hot backup directly takes away a lot of headache  
15:29 <vmassol> oracle has one driver per version of the DB  
15:29 <vmassol> (ojdbc6.jar)  
15:30 <vmassol> the 6 references the JVM version  
15:30 <vmassol> (java 6)  
15:30 <vmassol> they have ojdbc7 for java 1.7  
15:30 <Slashman> hello, I just updated a wiki from xwiki-enterprise-common:amd64 6.4.2+1 -> 7.0 and when I try to access it, I have this error: http://pastie.org/private/rzbej8ygtxyzqexmpft8la  
15:30 <vmassol> (they don't seem to differentiate between jdbc 3 and 4)  
15:31 <vmassol> haha  
15:31 <vmassol> :)  
15:31 <vmassol> Slashman:  
15:31 <tmortagne> Slashman: just what we were talking about :)  
15:31 <vmassol> you need a jdbc4 driver  
15:31 <vmassol> starting with Xwiki 7.0  
15:31 <vmassol> we just realized it!  
15:31 <vmassol> :)  
15:31 <tmortagne> the issue is that we require jdbc4 and the debian package make jdbc3 the default  
15:31 <Slashman> tmortagne: oh sorry, I ddin't look at the chan  
15:31 <Trefex> Slashman: already reported  
15:31 <tmortagne> Slashman: see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1478 for the workaround found by Trefex  
15:31 <vmassol> Slashman: not yet in the release notes… so don't be sorry :)  
15:32 <vmassol> first we're deciding if that's ok to require jdbc4  
15:32 <vmassol> that's our current discussion  
15:33 <vmassol> tmortagne: I don't think requiring jdbc4 driver is an issue per see, it just means lots of people are going to have their wiki fail on startup  
15:33 <vmassol> and that's the point we need to decide to agree on or not  
15:33 <tmortagne> all the users of the debian package with postgre will hit the issue, if we decide it's ok I will have to pack some 7.0-1 version with an explicit link on jdbc4 jar to be safe  
15:34 <vmassol> the deiab package are the easy part :)  
15:34 <vmassol> \*debian  
15:34 <vmassol> because you can control this  
15:34 <vmassol> the WAR distribution is the one that will get the most problems  
15:35 <tmortagne> vmassol: we recomend jdbc4 in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationPostgreSQL  
15:35 <tmortagne> so that should be ok on that side  
15:35 <tmortagne> I doubt we changed that page very recently  
15:35 <vmassol> for pgsql  
15:35 <tmortagne> yes but mysql does not have this separation between jdbc 3 and 4  
15:36 <vmassol> in any case what I propose is to continue with this but  
15:36 <vmassol> 1) fix the debian package  
15:36 <vmassol> 2) add it in the RN  
15:36 <vmassol> 3) monitor what the users say and if becomes a problem we can always decide to go back in 7.1  
15:36 <vmassol> wdyt?  
15:37 <tmortagne> from what I see the issue is mostly with postgres, other seems to have a single driver  
15:37 <vmassol> seems so  
15:37 <tmortagne> working on the debian package  
15:37 <vmassol> ok adding the change in the RN  
15:38 <gsmeria> has quit  
15:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: added here too http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HPrerequisites so that it's clear  
15:40 <tmortagne> yes better
